ranked_diseases.explanation: Perfect match with all three reference cases showing identical phenotypic features of ataxia and aniridia. This is the classic presentation of Gillespie syndrome.
Features aniridia as a key component, though typically presents with Wilms tumor, genitourinary abnormalities, and intellectual disability rather than ataxia.
Rare syndrome that includes both aniridia and cerebellar ataxia, though typically also includes intellectual disability which is not mentioned in this case.
Isolated aniridia caused by PAX6 mutations. Ataxia is not a typical feature but could represent an unusual presentation or additional finding.
Features progressive ataxia and can have ocular manifestations including retinal degeneration, though aniridia is not typical.
